revised_title: Last Glacial Maximum North Atlantic Deep Water: A Persistent Role in the Global Carbon Cycle
tldr: This article reviews the literature on the behavior of Last Glacial Maximum North Atlantic Deep Water (nadw) and concludes that the nadw flux either reduced in magnitude but did not shut down or maintained the present flux but shifted to a shallower depth range. The evidence suggests that the North Atlantic played a persistent but perhaps somewhat diminished role in the global thermohaline circulation during glacial times.
